sentences: Mogubai Kurdikar (15 July 1904 – 10 February 2001) was a renowned Indian classical vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana.
Early years and background ==
section: == Early years and background ==

sentences: In 1913, when she was ten years old, her mother, Jayashree, took her to the temple at Zambaulim and arranged for a wandering holyman to teach music to Mogu for a while.

sentences: In 1919, Mogu was taken by her aunt for medical treatment to Sangli.

sentences: She solicited a promise that Alladiya would teach her himself in the future if his brother Hyder Khan ever failed to do so.
section: == Career == | === Alladiya Khan and the power struggle in Bombay ===

sentences: Alladiya summoned Hyder Khan from Kolhapur and Mogu's training in the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana commenced under his tutelage in 1926.
section: == Career == | === Alladiya Khan and the power struggle in Bombay ===

sentences: In 1931, Alladiya felt forced to persuade his brother to stop teaching and leave town, but came clean to the heartbroken Mogu about what had happened which led to him breaking his promise to her.

section: == Awards and honours ==

sentences: The subcontinent's many royal courts had supported the music for centuries, but there was no large middle class and no widespread public appreciation; now the courts were on the remove, and the budding recording industry did not have anything like today's large commercial base.
